alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Ashe; Watauga (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Alleghany, central Watauga, Ashe Counties in northwestern North Carolina and southeastern Grayson Counties in southwestern Virginia through 1015 PM EDT... At 929 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a broken line of thunderstorms along a line extending from near Spring Valley to near Lansing to near Mountain City. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sparta... Jefferson... West Jefferson... Independence... Lansing... Mouth Of Wilson... and Glendale Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
